results.title: The Odyssey
results.creator_credit: Burbank Films Australia and Roz Phillips
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Homer’s classic tale “The Odyssey” is designed for children. Odysseus’s classic adventures include his encounter with the Cyclops and his experiences in the land of the Lotus Eaters where his crew succumb to a strange lethargy. After ten years of wandering the seas in order to return to his island home of Ithica, Odysseus finds that all is not well in his kingdom on his return.

results.title: The Odds against
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker and Helen Kirstt Radin
results.brief_description: Explores the correctional system in the United States, including detention, probation, imprisonment and parole. Shows a contrast between older institutions and modern facilities and methods throughout the country. Narrated by Herschel Bernardi.

results.title: The Odd couple
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Howard W. Koch and Gene Saks
results.brief_description: Based on the Neil Simon play, Walter Matthau and Jack Lemmon star in this offbeat comedy about two divorced men who try to share an apartment in New York without killing each other. Lemmon plays the irritating Felix Unger, obsessive and fussy, who proves that cleanliness is not a virtue, but a mental illness! Matthau, plays the slob Oscar Madison, who wreaks havoc on a room with the speed and thoroughness of a tornado. The performances are excellent, and the precision timing of the two actors infuses the film with a sense of spontaneity.

results.title: The Odd Angry Shot
results.creator_credit: Samson Productions, Sue Milliken and Tom Jeffrey
results.brief_description: John Jarratt plays a young man who enlists to serve in Vietnam. The film follows him as he serves active duty in one of the toughest of army units - the Australian Special Air Service. In between the savagery of combat the men of the unit gamble, play tricks on each other and drink a numbing amount of alcohol. This hard-edged comedy is a celebration of the Australian male ethos of larrikinism. Amid both the horror and tedium of war, it is only the mens’ sense of humour that saves them from descending into madness. One of the few Australian features to deal directly with Australian combat in Vietnam, “The Odd Angry Shot” features an excellent cast including John Hargreaves, Bryan Brown, Graeme Blundell and Graham Kennedy. Based on the novel by William Nagle.

results.title: The October man
results.creator_credit: Two Cities Films, Eric Ambler and Roy Baker
results.brief_description: In this powerful thriller, John Mills plays a lonely man who is recovering from a nervous breakdown. Through mysterious circumstances, he is suspected of a local murder and his past only confirms everyone’s suspicion of his guilt. His only hope is to prove his innocence himself. This superbly crafted movie benefits from a strong central performance by John Mills. The script, by Eric Ambler, could be a model for many of today’s thriller writers. This is a classic British mystery that absolutely bristles with suspense.

results.title: The Occupant
results.creator_credit: Masterthief Enterprises, Peter Lyssiotis, Ettore Siracusa and Michael Karris
results.brief_description: An experimental look at the migrant experience through the alienation of a Greek photographer. The photographer, Peter Lyssiotis, with memories of his homeland Cyprus, his relationship with his father and fantasies based in the photographer’s everyday life is well known for his work in photography, photomontage and photo books. He recently collaborated with Ettore Siracusa and Michael Karaglanidis on this film which explores some of the themes and practices of his photographic work.

results.title: The Objectives of criminal punishment
results.creator_credit: Video Classroom, Geoff Russell and Peter Wiseman
results.brief_description: What is the objective of criminal sanctions imposed on individuals found guilty of breaking the community’s laws? Reveals the many dilemmas faced by our legal systemin balancing society’s expectation for protection (and the punishment and rehabilitation of offenders) against the rights of the criminal in order to ultimately reach a ‘just’ outcome. Explores and evaluates the goals of the criminal justice system: Community Protection, Reform, Rehabilitation, Deterrence, Retribution. Includes teacher’s notes.

results.title: The Oberon submarine
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations and Vincent Donovan

results.title: The Obedient flame
results.creator_credit: Science Film, John Grierson and Norman McLaren
results.brief_description: Charming promotional film extolling the virtues of gas cooking through a series of simple animations. Gender stereotypes are anachronistic, but innocent rather than patronising - intended audience was contemperaneous “housewives”. McLaren’s animations employ an economical graphic style strongly influenced by the art deco and industrial aesthetics of the day - as always, stiking and appealing. The last film Norman McLaren made in the United Kingdom.
